greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of idempotent numbers binomial(n,k)*k^(n-k), version 3.
reference: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 91, #43 and p. 135, [3i'].
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := Binomial[n, k]*(n - k)^k; Prepend[Flatten@Table[t[n, k], {n, 10}, {k, 0, n}], 1] (* _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Mar 23 2013 *)
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle: */ [[Binomial(n,k)*(n-k)^k: k in [0..n]]: n in [0.. 15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 22 2015
(PARI) concat([1], for(n=0, 25, for(k=0, n, print1(binomial(n,k)*(n-k)^k, ", ")))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 05 2017
xref: There are 4 versions: A059297-A059300. Diagonals give A001788, A036216, A040075, A050982, A002378, 3*A002417, etc. Row sums are A000248.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 25 2001
